text:
‘What’s up?’  
‘Where did she go, and when’s she coming back?’  
‘Hmm… Ugh! We could ask… but she never really goes anywhere.’  
He yanked at the door-handle again.  
‘Ugh! There’s nothing left to do, we have to go!’  
‘Wait!’ the young guy suddenly said. ‘Do you see how the door shakes when you pull it?’  
‘So?’  
‘That means it’s not locked, just hooked! Hear that clanking sound?’  
‘Okay, and?’  
‘Don’t you get it? That means someone’s home. If they were all out, they’d have locked it from the outside, not just hooked it from the inside. Hear that? The hook’s clanking! They’re in there and just not opening the door!’  
‘Wow! You might be right!’ Koch said, surprised. ‘What are they doing in there?’ He started shaking the door like crazy.  
‘Hold on!’ the young man shouted again. ‘Don’t pull on it! Something’s off… You’ve been ringing and tugging, and they still won’t open up! So either they’ve both passed out or…’  
‘Or what?’  
‘Let’s go get the porter. He can wake them up.’

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man deduces that someone is home despite the door not being opened, prompting a decision to fetch the porter for assistance.
